content:
# I successfully crafted 1 stone furnace, and my inventory now contains:
# - 1 stone furnace
# - 5 coal
# - 5 stone
# - 1 iron plate
# - 5 iron gear wheels

# With the new stone furnace in hand, I can place it down and set it up for smelting more iron ore. 
# This will allow me to increase my production of iron plates.

# First, I will find a suitable location to place the new stone furnace. 
# After placing it, I will also need to insert some coal and iron ore to start the smelting process.

# Let's find a valid position to place the new furnace.
furnace_position = nearest_buildable(Prototype.StoneFurnace)  # Find a valid position to place the furnace
place_entity(Prototype.StoneFurnace, position=furnace_position)  # Place the new stone furnace

# Now I will insert coal and iron ore into the new furnace for smelting.
insert_item(Prototype.Coal, furnace_position, quantity=5)  # Insert coal into the new furnace
insert_item(Prototype.IronOre, furnace_position, quantity=5)  # Insert iron ore into the new furnace

# Finally, I will check the status of the new furnace to ensure it is set up correctly for smelting.
print(f"New Furnace status after adding resources: {inspect_inventory(furnace_position)}")  # Check the contents of the new furnace after adding resources.
